sections.name: Root Rotter
Corruption Spreaders
sections.text: A root rotter that remains in place for 24 hours causes a 5-foot emanation to become overgrown with foulsmelling unpleasant fungus. This spread increases by 5 feet for each additional 24 hours the root rotter remains motionless, to a maximum area of a 60-foot emanation after 12 days of motionless lurking. This fungus is permanent as long as it has a source of nourishment but can be destroyed as easily as any patch of mundane fungus.

link.name: Pathfinder #210: Whispers in the Dirt pg. 85
link.alt: Pathfinder #210: Whispers in the Dirt pg. 85

sections.text: Root rotters are all that remain of the unfortunate elven residents of Greengold. Some died in the initial bursts of Jeharlu spores, while others succumbed to infestation by sinmolds. Fungus now riddles their bodies, wrapping around their brains and nerves to reanimate them.

link.name: Pathfinder #210: Whispers in the Dirt pg. 85
link.alt: Pathfinder #210: Whispers in the Dirt pg. 85

link.name: Pathfinder #210: Whispers in the Dirt pg. 85
link.alt: Pathfinder #210: Whispers in the Dirt pg. 85

traits.name: Rare
traits.text: This rarity indicates that a rules element is very difficult to find in the game world. A rare feat, spell, item or the like is available to players only if the GM decides to include it in the game, typically through discovery during play. Creatures with this trait are rare. They typically can't be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creatures is increased by 5.

traits.name: Medium
traits.text: *Space:* 5 feet, *Reach (Tall):* 5 feet, *Reach (Long):* 5 feet

traits.name: Fungus
traits.text: Fungal creatures have the fungus trait. They are distinct from normal fungi.

traits.name: Undead
traits.text: Once living, these creatures were infused after death with void energy and soul-corrupting unholy magic. When reduced to 0 Hit Points, an undead creature is destroyed. Undead creatures are damaged by vitality energy and are healed by void energy, and don’t benefit from healing vitality effects.

traits.name: Unholy
traits.text: Effects with the unholy trait are tied to powerful magical forces of cruelty and sin. They often have stronger effects on holy creatures. Creatures with this trait are strongly devoted to unholy causes, and often have weakness to holy. If a creature with weakness to unholy uses an unholy item or effect, it takes damage from its weakness.

link.name: Pathfinder #210: Whispers in the Dirt pg. 85
link.alt: Pathfinder #210: Whispers in the Dirt pg. 85

universal_monster_ability.name: Telepathy
universal_monster_ability.text: A monster with telepathy can communicate mentally with any creatures within the listed radius, as long as they share a language. This doesn't give any special access to their thoughts and communicates no more information than normal speech would.

traits.name: Aura
traits.text: An aura is an emanation that continually ebbs out from you, affecting creatures within a certain radius. Aura can also refer to the magical signature of an item.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target’s mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

interaction_abilities.name: Fungus Sense
interaction_abilities.text: A root rotter has imprecise tremorsense to detect the vibrations of creatures who are within a region of fungal terrain shared by the root rotter.

universal_monster_ability.name: Void Healing
universal_monster_ability.text: A creature with void healing draws health from void energy rather than vitality energy. It is damaged by vitality damage and is not healed by healing vitality effects. It does not take void damage, and it is healed by void effects that heal undead.

automatic_abilities.name: Fungal Empowerment
automatic_abilities.text: If the root rotter is touching fungal terrain at the start of its turn, they regain 10 Hit Points and are quickened that turn; they can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike.

automatic_abilities.name: Fungal Mind

traits.name: Primal
traits.text:
This magic comes from the primal tradition, connecting to the natural world and instinct. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to primal magic.

automatic_abilities.text: Root rotters communicate telepathically with each other. While within telepathic range of at least one other root rotter, they gain a +2 circumstance bonus to initiative rolls, Perception checks, and saving throws against mental effects. If one root rotter is aware of a combatant, all members of the fungal mind within range are aware of it.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Poison
traits.text: An effect with this trait delivers a poison or deals poison damage. An item with this trait is poisonous and might cause an affliction.

traits.name: Unholy
traits.text: Effects with the unholy trait are tied to powerful magical forces of cruelty and sin. They often have stronger effects on holy creatures. Creatures with this trait are strongly devoted to unholy causes, and often have weakness to holy. If a creature with weakness to unholy uses an unholy item or effect, it takes damage from its weakness.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Unholy
traits.text: Effects with the unholy trait are tied to powerful magical forces of cruelty and sin. They often have stronger effects on holy creatures. Creatures with this trait are strongly devoted to unholy causes, and often have weakness to holy. If a creature with weakness to unholy uses an unholy item or effect, it takes damage from its weakness.

ability.name: Disperse

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Poison
traits.text: An effect with this trait delivers a poison or deals poison damage. An item with this trait is poisonous and might cause an affliction.

traits.name: Unholy
traits.text: Effects with the unholy trait are tied to powerful magical forces of cruelty and sin. They often have stronger effects on holy creatures. Creatures with this trait are strongly devoted to unholy causes, and often have weakness to holy. If a creature with weakness to unholy uses an unholy item or effect, it takes damage from its weakness.

ability.requirement: The root rotter has 25 Hit Points or fewer
ability.effect: The root rotter destroys themself. Thorny fungal roots explode from their body, dealing 10d6 piercing damage in a 10-foot emanation (DC 25 basic Reflex save). Any creature who fails the save is exposed to rotter infestation.

ability.name: Fungal Root

traits.name: Divine
traits.text:
This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to divine magic.

traits.name: Poison
traits.text: An effect with this trait delivers a poison or deals poison damage. An item with this trait is poisonous and might cause an affliction.

traits.name: Unholy
traits.text: Effects with the unholy trait are tied to powerful magical forces of cruelty and sin. They often have stronger effects on holy creatures. Creatures with this trait are strongly devoted to unholy causes, and often have weakness to holy. If a creature with weakness to unholy uses an unholy item or effect, it takes damage from its weakness.

ability.success: The creature takes half damage and becomes clumsy 1 until the end of its next turn.
ability.failure: The creature takes full damage and becomes clumsy 1 with an unlimited duration. In addition, the creature is restrained (Escape DC 27) for 1 minute.
ability.critical_failure: As failure but double damage. In addition, the creature is exposed to rotter infestation.
ability.text: Requirements The root rotter is standing in fungal terrain; Effect Fungal roots reach out to snag a nearby foe. An enemy within 30 feet of the root rotter takes 4d6 piercing damage and must attempt a DC 27 Reflex saving throw.

traits.name: Disease
traits.text: An effect with this trait applies one or more diseases. A disease is typically an affliction.

traits.name: Divine
traits.text:
This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to divine magic.

stages.name: Stage 2
stages.text: drained 2 and can sense the presence of root rotters within 30 feet as an imprecise sense (1 round)

stages.name: Stage 3
stages.text: as stage 2, but transformation into a root rotter upon death (1 day)
